title: AI Has Learned to Create Fake News Stories
summary: Resume Subscription. Real-sounding but made-up news articles have become much easier to produce thanks to a handful of new tools powered by artificial intelligence-raising concerns about potential misuse of the technology.

title: The Worlds That AI Might Create
summary: Artificial intelligence will have a profound impact-on our jobs, our health and possibly our very existence. But that's where consensus ends.. When it comes to artificial intelligence, there's a clear consensus: It is a growing presence in our offices and homes. But the consensus ends when you ask the next question: What will it mean?

title: Test Your Knowledge About the History of AI
summary: Take this Wall Street Journal quiz to see if you know how Isaac Asimov, the Logic Theorist and more fit into the story of artificial intelligence. People imagined something like artificial intelligence long before there was a Silicon Valley. In fact, the concept is probably as old as the human imagination.

title: Oil and Gas Companies Turn to AI to Cut Costs
summary: Artificial intelligence helps predict equipment glitches, manage workers and increase output. Amid a growing push to cut operating costs, big oil is looking to artificial intelligence for help with automating functions, predicting equipment problems and increasing the output of oil and gas.

title: Typhoon Hagibis Slams Japan, Kills Dozens
summary: Some areas got a third of the annual average rainfall in just a matter of hours, triggering floods. TOKYO-One of Japan's worst typhoons in decades brought record-breaking rainfall to broad swaths of the country, killing more than two dozen people and causing breaches in river levees that submerged low-lying areas.

title: Democrats Push Warren for Plan to Pay for Medicare for All
summary: Bernie Sanders says he would increase taxes and lower premiums; Ms. Warren hasn't been so specific. Sen. Elizabeth Warren has been dogged from the debate stage to town halls to late-night TV shows by questions about whether she plans to unveil a signature health-care proposal-and how she would pay for expanding government-run insurance.

title: Envoy to Testify He Took Trump's Denial of Ukraine Quid Pro Quo at His Word
summary: The U.S. ambassador to the EU to say he couldn't independently verify president's assertion. WASHINGTON-The U.S. ambassador to the European Union plans to tell Congress that President Trump personally assured him that there was no quid pro quo relationship between a package of aid for Ukraine and Mr. Trump's request that the Ukrainians open investigations, including into former Vice President Joe Biden and his son, according to a person familiar with the ambassador's planned testimony.

title: 'I'm Out': PG&E Blackouts Stagger Californians
summary: Resume Subscription. EUREKA, Calif.-Melanie Bettenhausen was learning to live with the devastating wildfires that periodically sweep through Northern California, but she isn't sure she can endure the alternative offered by PG&E Corp.: mass blackouts.

title: Legal Expert Looks Set to Become Tunisia's New President
summary: Exit polls show Kais Saied won a landslide in the North African country. A legal scholar is poised for victory in Tunisia's presidential election after his rival conceded defeat, as the North African country consolidates its position as the only democracy to emerge from the tumult of the Arab Spring.

title: U.S. Military to Withdraw From Northern Syria
summary: Move clears the way for expanded attacks against the Kurds and marks an accelerated U.S. pullback from the campaign against Islamic State. WASHINGTON-President Trump directed a full withdrawal of U.S. troops from northern Syria, Defense Secretary Mark Esper said, effectively pulling them from the country, removing a last impediment to Turkey's expanding incursion and marking an accelerated U.S. pullback from the campaign against Islamic State.

title: SoftBank Seeks WeWork Control Via Financing Package
summary: Potential deal would ease WeWork's cash crunch and further sideline co-founder Neumann. SoftBank Group Corp. has prepared a financing package that would give it control of WeWork and further sideline its founder Adam Neumann in exchange for relieving the shared-office startup's looming cash crunch, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Upstate New York Democrat Who Opposes Impeachment Walks Fine Line
summary: Anthony Brindisi helped his party regain the majority in the U.S. House, but he represents a district carried by President Trump in 2016. The House of Representatives' inquiry into whether President Trump should be impeached has U.S. Rep. Anthony Brindisi taking fire from both sides.

title: Democrats Seek to Keep Ohio a Battleground
summary: President Trump won Ohio in 2016 by eight percentage points, and Republicans dominated most statewide races in the midterms. NORTH RIDGEVILLE, Ohio-This quintessential presidential battleground state has some Democrats fearing it is trending away from them and might already be out of reach.

title: Islamic State Affiliates Break Free From Camp in Syria
summary: Escape exacerbates fear that Turkish incursion will allow the extremist group to rebuild strength. Hundreds of foreign women and children linked to Islamic State escaped from a camp in northeastern Syria when Turkish-backed fighters attacked it, U.S.-backed Kurdish forces controlling the area said, raising fears that the Turkish offensive will undermine American efforts to eliminate the extremist group.

title: The China Trade Truce
summary: Both sides agree to a temporary peace to avoid more economic harm.. President Trump on Friday announced a trade deal with China that he called "tremendous" or "tremendously" positive 15 times. The details look far more modest to us, but this truce in the trade war beats the alternative of escalating tariffs that have already caused a significant global economic slowdown.

title: Adam Schiff's 'Grand Jury'
summary: The House Democrat justifies his impeachment secrecy as if he's running a criminal trial.. Donald Trump is lucky in his opponents. Hillary Clinton was a bad candidate, and now House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has chosen Rep. Adam Schiff to be the face of impeachment for Democrats.

title: Make Dishwashers That Clean Again
summary: The Energy Department wants to give consumers an appliance choice.. The political campaign to use less fossil-fuel energy has real-world consequences, and one is that modern appliances don't work like they used to. The Trump Energy Department wants to let manufacturers make better dishwashers, and consumers are welcoming the idea. Manufacturers, not so much.

title: India's Richest Man Battles Amazon, Walmart to Work With Mom-and-Pop Shops
summary: Reliance Industries and the U.S. retail giants want small local stores to help them reach India's middle class. MUMBAI-India's ubiquitous mom-and-pop stores are being weaponized in e-commerce wars, as Walmart Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. square off against India's richest man in the country's nascent online retail market.

title: Poland's Ruling Nationalists Look Narrowly Poised to Return to Power for Another Four Years
summary: Exit polls had the conservative Law and Justice party ahead in an election with the heaviest participation since the 1989 vote that ended Communism. WARSAW-Poland's nationalist ruling party looked narrowly poised to return to power for another four years, according to exit polls from a general election that saw the highest turnout since 1989.

title: Brexit Deal Hangs in Balance as Deadline Looms
summary: Diplomats say no breakthrough reached; talks set to continue ahead of summit. British Prime Minister Boris Johnson heads into the most important week of his leadership as an elusive Brexit deal hangs in the balance.

title: Cat-Litter Rivals Pounce on New Shipping Strategies
summary: Clorox, Nestlé spend millions on factories to cut high costs for making and transporting heavy product. Cat-litter companies worked to make their products fresher, less dusty and easier to clean. Now they are chasing a new goal: moving those products more cheaply.

title: Typhoon Hagibis Drenches Japan
summary: Tokyo-area streets, beaches and train stations were deserted. Store shelves were bare after people stocked up on water and food.. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Impeachment, Secret or Not, Roils the House
summary: It's time for Nancy Pelosi to call for a vote in the House that would authorize an open investigation with witnesses, cross-examinations, public depositions and witness biographies.. Regarding your editorial "Impeachment in Secret" (Oct. 9): I was a senior officer at the CIA for nearly 18 years. In my career with the CIA, in industry and as a consultant, I had the opportunity to frequently interact with both the House and Senate Intelligence Committees. The hallmark of these committees over the years was that they were led and managed in a nonpartisan manner no matter which party held the chair of the committee. This nonpartisan approach to their important oversight role gave the committees great credibility, as the participants knew that the members' fundamental interest was in nonpartisan oversight of the intelligence community (IC) (an important role) and in what was best for the country relative to the tasks assigned to the IC. Unfortunately, the current chairman, Rep. Adam Schiff, has demolished this nonpartisan approach and, in the process, has destroyed the credibility of this important committee.

title: Arrests May Drop but Minor Crimes Are Not Dropping
summary: Commit a "minor crime" and nothing happens to you. Don't ask law-abiding people how we feel about this new and improved approach to criminal behavior.. Regarding "Arrests Drop Sharply for Minor Crimes" (U.S. News, Oct. 7): Certainly this must be good news we can applaud. But let's mute the applause button for a moment and look at the flip side.

title: Trade Uncertainty Clouds Global Growth Prospects
summary: Even as U.S. and China take steps toward a truce, businesses are holding back on investment. Small steps toward a trade truce between China and the U.S. last week likely aren't enough to diminish uncertainties that are holding back global economic growth.

title: Trump Wins Every Democratic Debate
summary: Lots of voters dislike the president but will be convinced to vote for him by seeing his opponents.. The Republican National Committee should offer to be the official sponsor of a weekly Democratic presidential debate. There would be no better advertisement for President Trump's re-election. Every time the Democratic presidential contenders gather together, it's a contest between the merely delusional, the vaguely vindictive and the patently absurd.

title: Mark Twain on the Red Meat Issue
summary: The abundance of contradictory studies on foods to emerge over the years reminds me of Mark Twain's cynical, scathing but apt advice.. Regarding your editorial "The Red Meat Rethink" (Oct. 3): The abundance of contradictory studies on foods to emerge over the years reminds me of Mark Twain's cynical, scathing but apt advice: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like, and let the food fight it out inside you." Cheers and bon appétit.

title: How Parents Helped Transform a Los Angeles School
summary: The success of Twentieth Street Elementary should inspire reform efforts in California and nationwide.. Los Angeles

title: Honest Ads Act Is False Advertising
summary: It won't stop foreigners from meddling in U.S. elections, but it would traduce free speech.. This article is signed by Bradley A. Smith, Lee E. Goodman, and Michael E. Toner, all former chairmen of the Federal Election Commission.

title: Beijing Tries To Bully Congress
summary: We were told we'd get visas to visit the mainland only if we abandoned our planned trip to Taiwan.. China took the extraordinary step earlier this month of denying visas to a bipartisan American congressional delegation. We were barred from the country for one reason only-our planned visit to Taiwan.

title: 'The Cigarette' Review: No Smoking, Please
summary: Until the 1960s, liberal government policies ensured the success of the tobacco industry. Then came the surgeon general's report.. The political philosopher Kenneth Minogue, in his classic study "The Liberal Mind" (1963), memorably compared modern liberalism in its prime to St. George slaying the dragon. From the 16th century to the 19th, the dragons were enormous: religious intolerance, slavery and the slave trade, wretched prison conditions. But liberalism, unlike St. George, did not know when to retire, and in the 20th century it "grew breathless in [its] pursuit of smaller and smaller dragons-for the big dragons were now harder to come by."

title: What if You Couldn't Subscribe to Netflix?
summary: An obsolete law stops broadcasters from making their services available to everyone.. What if Congress passed a law mandating that Netflix , YouTube and other video providers would each be barred from making their services available to an arbitrary fraction of American households? It's absurd, but that's the reality for owners of traditional television broadcast stations-a restriction that makes less sense than ever in today's diverse video marketplace. The Federal Communications Commission could help.

title: Bondholders and Venezuelan Democracy
summary: Maduro's default could cost opponents control of Citgo and bolster the dictator.. On Oct. 28, $913 million in principal and interest will be due on a bond issued by Petróleos de Venezuela, the state-owned oil monopoly, known as PdVSA. The contract says the bond, which matures in 2020, is secured by a controlling stake in U.S. oil refiner Citgo. Venezuela's expected failure to make the payment will trigger an immediate default.

title: What's a Wealth Tax Worth?
summary: Warren and Sanders's plans to pilfer savings would hurt investment with little benefit.. Why do liberals think rich people have money just lying around, like Scrooge McDuck swimming in a giant pool of gold coins? That's the myth behind plans to tax Americans' wealth, as Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Bernie Sanders both propose.

title: Impeachment Inquiry Challenges Balance of Power in Washington
summary: Previous efforts have transformed the relationship between Congress and the Presidency. WASHINGTON-The widening conflict between the Democratic-led House of Representatives and the Trump administration could alter the balance of power between Congress, the presidency and the courts for years.

title: Los Angeles Area Fire Threat Fades
summary: Firefighters lift all evacuation orders for Saddleridge blaze, though battle to contain it continues. Los Angeles firefighters lifted all evacuation orders Saturday afternoon after determining that threats from a wildfire near the northern edge of the city had mainly passed.

title: Move Over Brexit, a New Feud Is Riveting the U.K.
summary: Resume Subscription. LONDON-If anything could make the British forget about Brexit, it was this: The wives of two of the country's best-known soccer players having it out over who has been leaking tittle-tattle to the country's tabloid newspapers.

title: Economy Week Ahead: U.S. Retail Sales and China GDP
summary: Economists also forecast China's GDP grew 6.1% in third quarter, down from 6.2% in second quarter. In the week ahead, the U.S. will receive fresh numbers on retail sales and industrial production. China will publish figures on trade and economic growth.

title: NYPD Investigating Shooting in Apparent Brooklyn Gambling Den
summary: No arrests have been made in Saturday altercation that left four people dead at the Triple A Aces social club. Detectives in Brooklyn are piecing together a Saturday morning shooting that left four people dead in what police believed was an illegal gambling den in the Crown Heights neighborhood, New York Police Department officials said.

title: Marathon Records Test the Limits of Human Physiology
summary: Brigid Kosgei demolished the women's world record by more than a minute at the Chicago Marathon, one day after Eliud Kipchoge broke the 2-hour barrier. Brigid Kosgei of Kenya demolished the women's world record by more than a minute at the Chicago Marathon on Sunday, erasing a mark that had stood for more than 16 years.

title: China, Facing Slowdown, Unlikely to Push for More Stimulus
summary: Beijing shifts from seeking quick fix to focusing on putting economy on healthier long-term footing. BEIJING-China's economy keeps flashing warning signs that it is losing steam-but, unlike past episodes, Beijing isn't likely to stoke the fires to boost growth.

title: Why the Irish Border Has Hamstrung Brexit
summary: U.K.'s only land border is at the center of as issue that ended Theresa May's premiership-and is testing her successor. LONDON-Britain's plans for Brexit have been bedeviled by the U.K.'s only land border.

title: Weekend Talks Between EU and U.K. to Continue Monday, Says EU
summary: Latest Brexit negotiations produce no breakthrough, say diplomats.

title: Cuomo Says $900 Million Bridge Sped Up Traffic. Drivers May Disagree.
summary: Replacement Kosciuszko Bridge's layout and increased interest do little to fix notorious rush-hour bottlenecks. When New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo opened the new Kosciuszko Bridge in August, he predicted that average speeds along that section of the traffic-clogged Brooklyn-Queens Expressway would increase by 65%.

title: The Workhorse Starting Pitcher Is Back
summary: Starters are going deeper into playoff games than they have in years; 'It's sort of fun doing it this way'. The traditional starting pitcher, the backbone of baseball rosters for more than a century, seemed like a fading relic when the playoffs began. Starters accounted for just 58% of innings pitched across the majors this year, setting a record low for the fourth straight year. Recent postseasons only exacerbated the trend, with starters and relievers essentially splitting the outs last October.

title: Investors Pull Money Out of Stock Funds, Squeezing Money Managers
summary: Pullback from stock funds set to weigh on firms' third-quarter earnings. Cautious investors pulled $60 billion out of stock funds in the third quarter, ratcheting up pressure on money managers.

title: Wegmaniacs Count the Days to Brooklyn Store Opening
summary: Alumni group plans field trip; it 'gives you that warm, fuzzy feeling'. On a warm day last winter, Julie Russell walked the 1.1-mile route from her apartment to the Brooklyn Navy Yard, where the future home of her favorite grocery store was still under construction.

title: Hong Kong Protesters Maintain Pressure Ahead of Speech by City's Leader
summary: Demonstrators build roadblocks, smash storefronts and clash with police; China's Xi issues warning. HONG KONG-Antigovernment protesters built roadblocks, smashed storefronts and clashed with police in multiple locations around the city on Sunday, as demonstrators sought to keep pressure on Hong Kong's government ahead of a major policy speech by the city's leader and the reconvening of the legislature.

title: Should Consumers Be Able to Sell Their Own Personal Data?
summary: Two advocates square off over whether consumers will be helped or hurt by being able to own and sell their own data. People around the world are confused and concerned about what companies do with the data they collect from their interactions with consumers.

title: In 'Limetown,' the Social Network Starts to Fray
summary: The podcast-turned-TV series on Facebook Watch stars Jessica Biel and Stanley Tucci and explores the dark risks of our interconnected age. Skip Bronkie and Zack Akers wanted to make a podcast before they had a story, but even when they settled on a premise, they didn't entirely get it.

title: Late Angels Pitcher Received Drugs From Team Employee
summary: Tyler Skaggs died in July with oxycodone, fentanyl and alcohol in his system. An Angels employee said he provided oxycodone to Skaggs and abused it with him.. Los Angeles Angels pitcher Tyler Skaggs's July death-with oxycodone, fentanyl and alcohol in his system-has opened a new and explosive drug problem for Major League Baseball, as an Angels' public-relations executive has spoken to federal investigators about his own drug use with Skaggs and the team's alleged knowledge of the situation.

title: Her Superb Swimming Didn't Stop With Pregnancy
summary: Resume Subscription. Lauren Au Brinkmeyer spent two years training and gained 10 pounds to swim the English Channel. After completing the approximately 21-mile crossing in July 2018 in 11 hours and 54 seconds, she was prepared to hang up her swim cap and start a family in Oakland, Calif., with her husband.

title: This Quarter, Bank Earnings Are All About Rates
summary: Results starting Tuesday will show what lower rates mean for JPMorgan, Citi, others. Investors will get an early readout on the impact of the Federal Reserve's recent interest-rate cuts when big U.S. banks report third-quarter earnings this week.

title: Medical Device Stocks Are in Rude Health
summary: Investors love growth potential of devices, but high valuations mean a strong earnings season is needed. When earnings season begins in earnest this week, health-care investors will be relying on pacemakers and artificial knees.

title: Executives Rethink Social-Media Policies After China Dust-Up
summary: Companies set the rules when it comes to public expression by corporate executives. Chief executives are taking vocal stands on issues like gun control, climate change and immigration, but global affairs bring a different complexity and calculation, especially for companies doing business in China.

title: U.S. Moves to Restart Taliban Peace Process
summary: Top U.S. envoy meets with Taliban in bid to revive deal; measures could include prisoner swap or reduction in violence. WASHINGTON-U.S. officials and representatives of the Afghan Taliban have begun discussing ways to revive a peace process after talks fell apart last month, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: The Medicaid Experiment in Arkansas: Thousands Lost Coverage, Few Gained Jobs
summary: Resume Subscription. WEST MEMPHIS, Ark.-With the help of Medicaid, Stanley Ellis got two hip-replacement surgeries and other care to treat a condition that causes bone tissue to die.

title: Yankees Continue Postseason Roll to Take ALCS Lead
summary: Gleyber Torres drove in five runs and Masahiro Tanaka threw six scoreless innings to put New York ahead, 1-0, in the best-of-seven series. HOUSTON-There is still a long way for the New York Yankees to go, seven more victories they'll need to win the World Series. But so far, just about everything is going right for them this month.

title: Medicaid and the Health-Care Policy Debate Ahead of 2020 Elections
summary: Trump has called for Medicaid work requirement, while Democrats support single federal health system. A Medicaid work requirement has emerged as a divisive policy issue in the 2020 presidential election. President Trump has called for adding a mandate nationwide, while some Democratic candidates are proposing a single federal health system that would subsume the program.

title: The Military Offers Women Pay Equity and Opportunity, but Few Still Make Top Ranks
summary: Though the armed services tout themselves as a meritocracy, for women the promise remains elusive. Military tradition holds that when an Army general is promoted, he bequeaths his old rank from the shoulder of his uniform to someone he thinks should be promoted next-a practice that has historically allowed men to pave the way for other men.

title: Don't Ask Me to Do Office Housework!
summary: Women are often expected to do the less-glamorous work, like buy birthday cards and take notes. Don't pour water for everyone at the conference table. Don't put that dirty mug in the office dishwasher. And definitely don't volunteer to take notes.

title: Sears Hasn't Fared Better After Bankruptcy
summary: Year after chapter 11, retailer struggles to keep stores stocked and convince shoppers it will survive. Sears's bankruptcy filing was supposed to give the troubled retailer a fresh start. But a year later, the chain is still struggling with many of the same problems it faced before it sought court protection.

title: Stocks' Path Toward Records Led by Defensive Plays
summary: Utilities stocks, real-estate investment trusts and other bets that tend to do better when investors are wary of volatility are outperforming the broader market. Hopes for a trade deal have sparked renewed optimism among stock investors. It is a cautious optimism, though.

title: Iran's Expanded Missile Arsenal Tests Mideast Defenses
summary: Tehran's military capabilities have grown, as Pentagon deploys antimissile systems and troops. BEIRUT-The U.S. announcement on Friday that it is delivering more missile-defense systems and troops to Saudi Arabia intensifies a face-off with Iran-which has warned that an attack on the country would trigger an "all-out war."

title: Trump Defends Rudy Giuliani After Hedging on His Status as Lawyer
summary: Giuliani said Saturday he was certain he was still the president's attorney. WASHINGTON-President Trump backed Rudy Giuliani a day after saying he wasn't sure if he was still his personal lawyer.

title: Protest Leaders in Ecuador Agree to Talks With the Government
summary: President Moreno imposes curfew as the country is rocked by demonstrations over the removal of fuel subsidies. QUITO, Ecuador-An umbrella organization for the indigenous groups that have been at the forefront of turbulent protests against President Lenín Moreno said Saturday that it agreed to direct talks with the government over the contentious removal of fuel subsides that had sparked the demonstrations.

title: Coal Bankruptcies Pile Up as Utilities Embrace Gas, Renewables
summary: Despite President Trump's promise to boost coal, at least seven large coal producers have filed for bankruptcy since October 2018. More than half a dozen large U.S. coal companies have filed for bankruptcy in the past year, a signal that the one-time king of American energy is fading as it faces competition from cheap natural gas and renewable-energy sources while reckoning with the retirement of coal-fired power plants.

title: Hunter Biden to Resign From Board of Chinese Private-Equity Firm
summary: Son of Joe Biden says he won't work for any foreign-owned companies or serve on their boards if his father is elected president. Hunter Biden is stepping down from a director's position at a Chinese private-equity firm and said he wouldn't serve on any foreign boards if his father, Joe Biden, is elected president, lowering his controversial business profile as it becomes embroiled in the 2020 election and Democrats' efforts to impeach President Trump.
